mainBoard.flavorText: The most frightening storms are those not woven by nature's hand.
mainBoard.name: Ball Lightning
mainBoard.originalText:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

rulings.text: The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

mainBoard.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice this creature.

mainBoard.name: Lightning Phoenix
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying, haste
Lightning Phoenix can't block.
At the beginning of your end step, if an opponent was dealt 3 or more damage this turn, you may pay {R}. If you do, return Lightning Phoenix from your graveyard to the battlefield.

rulings.text: If an opponent is dealt 3 or more damage and loses the game, Lightning Phoenix's ability triggers as your end step begins.

Lightning Phoenix's last ability looks at how much damage was dealt to opponents in the turn, even if it wasn't in your graveyard when the damage was dealt. It doesn't care if opponents gained life, even if they gained more than they were dealt damage.
Lightning Phoenix's last ability triggers only if it's in your graveyard as your end step begins and only if an opponent was dealt 3 or more damage before your end step begins.

mainBoard.text:
Flying, haste
This creature can't block.
At the beginning of your end step, if an opponent was dealt 3 or more damage this turn, you may pay {R}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

mainBoard.flavorText: Not all storms come from the sky.
mainBoard.name: Living Lightning
mainBoard.originalText: When Living Lightning dies, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: If an instant or sorcery spell you own causes Living Lightning to die, its ability can target that instant or sorcery card in your graveyard.

mainBoard.text: When this creature dies, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Lightning in a bottle? That's not where I need it."
mainBoard.name: Weaver of Lightning
mainBoard.originalText:
Reach
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Weaver of Lightning deals 1 damage to target creature an opponent controls.

rulings.text: Weaver of Lightning's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger, but after targets for that spell have been chosen.

mainBoard.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, this creature deals 1 damage to target creature an opponent controls.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The gods don't speak to mortals with gentle entreaties. They speak with thunder and fury."
mainBoard.name: Lightning Visionary
mainBoard.originalText: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
mainBoard.text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

—Norin the Wary
mainBoard.name: Lightning Elemental
mainBoard.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

mainBoard.flavorText:
"That's the third time this month it's exploded on site. Maybe we should switch to something a little less defective."
—Kerrin, archaeologist
mainBoard.name: Lightning-Core Excavator
mainBoard.originalText: {5}, {T}, Sacrifice Lightning-Core Excavator: It deals 3 damage to any target.
mainBoard.text: {5}, {T}, Sacrifice this creature: It deals 3 damage to any target.

mainBoard.name: Chain Lightning
mainBoard.originalText: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to any target. Then that player or that permanent's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, they may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

rulings.text: As Chain Lightning resolves, either the original or one of the copies, the targeted player or the controller of the targeted permanent may copy it. The copy has the same text, target, and color as the resolving spell, though the player creating the copy may choose a new target for it. Once that copy is created (or not), the Chain Lightning finishes resolving and leaves the stack.
If the targeted player or permanent is an illegal target as Chain Lightning tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve and none of its effects happen. It can't be copied.
The copy of Chain Lightning is created on the stack, so it's not cast. Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. Players may respond to that spell before it resolves.
The player putting the copy of the spell on the stack controls that copy.

mainBoard.text: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to any target. Then that player or that permanent's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, they may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

mainBoard.flavorText: Spirits disturbed by ghoulcallers become geists driven by restless anger.
mainBoard.name: Lightning Axe
mainBoard.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card or pay {5}.
Lightning Axe deals 5 damage to target creature.

rulings.text: The mana value of Lightning Axe is 1, no matter which additional cost you paid.

mainBoard.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card or pay {5}.
Lightning Axe deals 5 damage to target creature.

mainBoard.name: Riddle of Lightning
mainBoard.originalText: Choose any target. Scry 3, then reveal the top card of your library. Riddle of Lightning deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that permanent or player. (To scry 3, look at the top three cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

rulings.text: If a card in a player's library has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.
If the chosen target is an illegal target by the time Riddle of Lightning tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. You don't scry 3 or reveal any card.

mainBoard.text: Choose any target. Scry 3, then reveal the top card of your library. Riddle of Lightning deals damage equal to that card's mana value to that permanent or player.

mainBoard.flavorText: "I fight for Keranos and for mortals. I see no contradiction."
mainBoard.name: Lightning Diadem
mainBoard.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Lightning Diadem enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to any target.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

rulings.text: If Lightning Diadem's target is an illegal target when it tries to resolve, it won't resolve and won't enter the battlefield. Its triggered ability won't trigger.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
When this Aura enters, it deals 2 damage to any target.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

mainBoard.flavorText: As eons passed, the rock wore away, revealing the rich colors at the mountain's heart.
mainBoard.name: Thriving Bluff
mainBoard.originalText:
Thriving Bluff enters the battlefield tapped.
As Thriving Bluff enters the battlefield, choose a color other than red.
{T}: Add {R} or one mana of the chosen color.
mainBoard.text:
This land enters tapped. As it enters, choose a color other than red.
{T}: Add {R} or one mana of the chosen color.
